attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 10 metres of a dwelling if it is hotter than 25C
attributes.background: In the summer, due to global warming, temperatures now regularly reach 30 - 35C. This is extremely hot and it is simply insulting to expect people to not open their windows because inconsiderate people are smoking outside their house.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hugely affected by this issue. Smokers pollute the environment and contribute to global warming. They also severely harm others with second hand smoke, especially children. 
Children are often unable to play in the garden in the summer due to the noxious gases being emitted from the smoke, this causes a deficiency in vitamin D. This law will apply to all areas (public or residential) unless the owner of the properties affected allows them to smoke. Penalty: £400 - 6 months

attributes.action: Remove Homework in all primary schools in England
attributes.background:
Child mental health is in the spotlight all the time - however pressures being placed on children under 11 is at an all time high.

The pressure placed on children under 11 from primary schools could be taken as being one of the root causes as well as lack of social skills.
attributes.additional_details:
Homework is is a burden on the students personal life, they already spend a lot of their week in school and it should be then that they learn.

Time outside of school should be left to the pupils to rest and take part in social activities so that they can make the most of their time in school without feeling tired and stressed and learn to have social skills outside of school.

If a working adult was asked to take work home each night they would not be happy with this and would not complete it.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to pay into the 'Teachers' Pension'.
attributes.background: Supply teachers cannot pay into the Teachers' Pension. If you are contracted for 2 hours a week you can opt-in, but as a supply teacher working 5 days a week you can't. Why? Because supply agencies don't employ us, so can't pay the employer's contribution. The ethics of agencies are another debate.
attributes.additional_details: Supply teachers used to be employed by LEAs. They were paid to scale, had pay progression and a pension. Successive governments have turned a blind eye to agencies taking this role where supply teachers are not paid to scale, have no pay progression and have no pension. A supply teacher will earn £16000 a year if they work every school day (the agencies having got £29,250 for that teacher). Some things we have to accept: the government signing our pension away, we shouldn't have to.

attributes.action: Ban Standing Charges on all Energy and Water Bills
attributes.background:
Standing Charges on Gas, Electricity and Water, bills are an unfair charge, and have no real basis on the amount of Energy or water used.
The standing charge is just another way for the Energy and Water Companies to unjustly increase their profits.
attributes.additional_details:
SSE charge £24.53 plus 5% VAT =  £26.98 on both Gas and Electricity,
For a dual fuel set up that adds £53.98 per quarter to the consumers bill, absolutely no real justification for this type of rip off.

attributes.action: Extend gender pay gap reporting rules to cover ethnicity pay gap
attributes.background: In April 2017, the government put into law a practice where employers with 250 or more employees must publish and report specific figures about their gender pay gap. We the undersigned call on the government to extend these reporting rules to ethnicity pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
Several companies and institutions have voluntarily published ethnicity pay gap data, which suggests ethnicity pay gap is as much of a problem as gender pay gap.

Tackling ethnicity pay gap is a national issue, and by making reporting on them mandatory, will, as with requirements to report gender pay gap, provide focus and momentum to enable positive change.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Change the law to protect parental contributions for house purchase on divorce
attributes.background: 1000s of parents are donating money to their son or daughter’s house purchases. Parents are providing part or all of the large deposits required in today’s inflated UK housing market. Currently there is no law protecting these funds in the event of a divorce and the Government needs to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Families are providing funds believing this money will stay with their children or indeed their grandchildren further down the line in the event of a divorce. This is not the case. Declaration of Trusts or similar deeds are ignored by judges and the non-contributing partner is wrongly benefitting.
Legal protection is needed to stop these contributions and inheritances disappearing from the original families.

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: HMG to advise Her Majesty to remove “Royal” from Borough of Kensington & Chelsea
attributes.background: On the Prime Minister’s advice, Wootton Basset was awarded the title “Royal” as a result of it's dedicated action. If this honour can be awarded it can also be removed. This should apply to Kensington and Chelsea as a result of the action prior to and inaction following the Grenfell Tower tragedy.
attributes.additional_details: It is an affront to British values for Kensington and Chelsea to continue to use the title “Royal”. The council leader has resigned. Responsibility for Grenfell Tower residents has been taken away from the council by HM Government. A public inquiry has been ordered by HM Government.

attributes.action: A UK wide once in a generation special Public Holiday to clear the UK of Litter
attributes.background: I would like to propose a once in a generation special public holiday to get everyone outside with recycled bin bags & litter pickers to help clear & tidy up their local areas from the unsightly litter that we all come across from day to day but never have the time to do it.  The UK is beautiful!
attributes.additional_details: Since I was a child I always remember thinking why do people throw their litter out of cars or discard it whilst walking.  It is something that I really feel strongly about. so what can I do about it?  I could spend my time endlessly picking after people. Or better still encourage everyone to do it!

attributes.action: The UK Government should provide financial aid solutions for future pilots
attributes.background: A major factor driving fewer people to take up the career is the cost of training. Aspiring pilots, who aren’t able to secure a place on the limited number of airline sponsored training schemes, need to find large sums of money to pay for their own training costs which can be upwards of £100,000.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/d7117f1e-d963-11e5-a72f-1e7744c66818

http://www.fta-global.com/fta-news/pilot-shortage-looms-but-uk-and-european-commercial-pilot-licence-issues-are-down

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/business-42917181/pilot-shortage-who-s-going-to-fly-our-planes

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-11691204

http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/articles/35126/balpa-warns-of-uk-pilot-shortage

attributes.action: International British Medical Students should be funded by the Government (SFE).
attributes.background: NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them!
attributes.additional_details: Student Finance England (SFE) should support British Medical Students studying in European or International Medical Universities.  NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them! These students are the backbone of the NHS!

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Increase the number of GCSE options that schools offer
attributes.background: The choices we have for GCSE's can be very limited within schools. In my GCSE choices I only had nine other options, other than the core few. This has limited my possible learning and perhaps my future.
attributes.additional_details: The choices you have limit what is possible in the future for me and others with limited choices.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.businessinsider.com/why-norways-prison-system-is-so-successful-2014-12?international=true&r=US&IR=T 

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.
https://food.ndtv.com/opinions/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarket-boycott-as-milk-price-falls-1204828
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/aug/06/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarkets-boycott-as-milk-price-falls
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/price-of-milk-to-go-up-after-dairy-closures-tr220h3sr

attributes.action: Reverse central government funding cuts to councils
attributes.background: Since 2010 central government has cut the funding to councils. It is planned that by 2020 funding by central government to councils will be reduced by 77%. Causing councils to have to make MORE devastating cuts to much needed services including social care, childrens services, education, and more.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the austerity cuts councils have had to make savings, and that has led to a spiraling funding problem, causing the most vulnerable to suffer, social services at crisis point, our roads in dire need of need repair and our children services and early years cut and cut again causing generational damage. It is time to realise that the decision of 2010 by Conservative/Lib Dem government is causing untold damage to the UK, and it needs to be reversed. Put the funding back into our councils.

attributes.action: British Citizens must be subject to UK taxation wherever they live in the world
attributes.background: The current system encourages high-earning individuals to leave the UK for tax purposes. This is not in the national interest.

attributes.action: Equality for men. Ban the use of urinals. Men should not be expected to use them
attributes.background: Women are able to urinate in private so why are men men expected to use urinals?  Yes, cubicles are also provided in most cases but they are typically being used by somebody that needs to do the alternative.  Men are under pressure to urinate next to another man despite the privacy concern.
attributes.additional_details: The smells that are emitted from the majority of urinals are awful. In addition, spare a thought for the cleaners. Also, banning the use of urinals would save an enormous quantity of water as the urinals typically flush automatically even when they are not being used. The time has come to provide equality for men and give us some privacy.

attributes.action: Change the long assessment format for people with M.E, which causes them stress
attributes.background: The payment for PIP for people with ME can take up to four months and every year they answer the same questions. ME is a condition that affect someone’s whole life or it can a short term illness of fatigue.  People who have ME are not all able to travel to hospitals for assessments, change is needed
attributes.additional_details: The stress of PIP assessment I have witnessed first hand, the process is too long and to have the assessment every year is unfair. That person’s health may not be any different since the year before. PIP needs to be considered being kept and not keep changing to another system, so that these people don’t have to worry about financial issues or become ill because of the long assessments and worry.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools/colleges to start lessons before 10AM
attributes.background: Child sleep disorders in the uk are on the rise. More and more children are developing mental health issues and their attitude, attendance and grades are getting worse. All because of one thing. School starting early. Most schools in the uk start their lessons around 8:30 and this is way too early.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sequential lighting indicators on cars; they are dangerously slow
attributes.background: Sequential lighting indicators use LEDs which expand over time to show the change of direction, these take a long time and can be distracting for other drivers.

attributes.action: Ban social media that doesnt confirm your age officially or allows you anonymity
attributes.background: Social media is far too often used as a barrier to hide behind and bully others. Snapchat, Facebook, Sarahah, need to start confirming children's ages with official documents and stop allowing users to remain anonymous. Bullying can kill and it must be stopped.

attributes.action: Scrap the government’s plan of building HS2 and build a Hyperloop system instead
attributes.background: Instead of spending billions of pounds of taxpayer’s money on a system that will take so long to complete that it will already be antiquated, the government should invest in a Hyperloop system, reducing journey times exponentially, with speeds of up to 700mph. Manchester to London in 18 minutes!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2017/08/26/britains-hyperloop-pipe-dream-meet-people-behind-uks-futuristic/

http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/hyperloop-one-richard-branson-virgin-investment-london-scotland-transport-travel-fast-a7998106.html

https://hyperloop-one.com

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public toilets to have better personal hygiene facilities
attributes.background: Everyday hundred of thousands of Britons use public bathrooms and there is only ever tissue! How can anyone clean them selves properly with just tissue. This also means that hundereds of thousand of Britons are walking around with with feces (harmful bacteria) on their bodies. It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details: more suitable cleaning apparatus EG: a Bidet shower

attributes.action: Changing a man's name after marriage.
attributes.background: Currently in the UK men are unable to use a marriage certificate as proof to change their name when taking their wife's last name. However woman are allowed to use a marriage certificate as proof to take the mans name. A man has to change his name by deed poll, a woman does not.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe in equality and for that reason a marriage certificate should be proof enough to change your name even if you are a man taking your wife's name, or a man taking your husband's name. 

Lets break the tradition and make a change.

attributes.action: Amend TUA 2016, so non-union members pay for benefits gained from Union work.
attributes.background:
Benefits negotiated by Trade unions at the workplace are enjoyed by union members & non-members alike.
e.g. Workplace offers 1% pay rise to workforce but through negotiations with trade union, an increased offer of 2.5% is agreed. Members & non-members alike are given a 2.5% pay rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Union members already make financial contribution to support their union to act on their behalf however non-members receive the benefit of this rise without having made any financial contribution to the costs of the union achieving this mutually beneficially outcome.
Make non-union members pay monthly contribution, not exceeding subs paid by union members or they will receive only the 1% payrise.

attributes.action: Lower wait time for new universal credit claims
attributes.background: The current wait time for new universal credit claims is 5 weeks. This means low income families go without money for that period and puts families in severe hardship. Tax credit claims by contrast only take 3 weeks. We need to speed this up to save families from making difficult decisions.

attributes.action: Increase funding and awareness for public transport in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is well known for being a modern and developed nation, but do we really do all that we can to make our country green? We are falling behind compared to many other countries. This directly affects everyone in the UK so take our country's future into your hands; sign now to have your say.

attributes.action: More funding for the treatment of schizophrenia and chronic mental illnesses.
attributes.background: It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the uk have a mental illness of some kind during their lifetime. At any one time about 220,000 people are being treated directly for schizophrenia in the UK by the NHS. Sufferers have the highest rates of suicide partly due to the Ill side effects of neuroleptic
attributes.additional_details:
More funding is needed to find a possible alternative to antipsychotics like cbd oil which has the potential to cure the disease short term without the side effects associated with neuroleptics.

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/ministryofhemp.com/blog/cbd-for-schizophrenia/amp/

https://www.livingwithschizophreniauk.org/facts-and-figures/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-17940070

attributes.action: Changing the legal age for vaping WITHOUT nicotine from 18 to 16.
attributes.background: By lowering the age from 18 to 16 will allow young people who smoke to turn to a safer alternative. This will lower the lung cancer rate in young people. Save lives and lower the vaping age.

attributes.action: Delay the introduction of accountable care organisations
attributes.background: Delay the introduction of accountable care organisations till after the Health Committee has the opportunity to review the evidence of their potential impact on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: ACOs are about saving money and closing services. The Secretary of State for Health needs to refrain from introducing them behind Parliament's back.

attributes.action: Build a Channel bridge between UK & France, to increase trade as we leave the EU
attributes.background: Build a Channel bridge between Britain and France to vastly increase trade between not just these two countries, but the entirety of Europe also. During uncertain times as we leave the European Union, such a project would reassure voters with increased economic confidence for the future.
attributes.additional_details: Would allow for easier access into both countries, making trade between UK and Europe much more easier.

attributes.action: Close planning loophole that allows homes to be converted to care homes
attributes.background: Make "Assisted Living" a category subject to planning regulation & approval, including drug, alcohol & mental health rehab. Planning regulations need urgently to be amended to protect private residential property owners.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can be powerless to stop homes being converted into care homes because the law is not clear enough. A new "Assisted Living" category would give local authorities and local residents proper powers to challenge new care homes being set up.

attributes.action: Ban knives longer than 4 inches.
attributes.background:
No person needs a knife longer than 4 inches. If this law is passed then the UK will have a reduction in crime. 
Please sign the petition to make the UK a safer place.

attributes.action: Streamline UK education by creating a single/governmental exam board
attributes.background: I'm at my 1st year of university. A lot of time is wasted covering content covered at A level; this was also true for A level regarding GCSEs. Why? Because multiple exam boards mean students don't cover the same content, so it has to be taught again at the next level of education.
attributes.additional_details:
One exam board would stop this.

Furthermore, revision resources are poor. But, converting to one exam board will create a single/larger market for people to produce educational content for, meaning it can be higher quality.

E.g. 2 At A-level, I wanted to produce a revision site for A-level STEM subjects, however it is a waste of time because too few students would use it, because there is too much content between the 5 different exam boards.

attributes.action: Change legislation around air pollution caused by fireworks, to improve health.
attributes.background: It’s the beginning of a new year and in many countries around the world, it has become a tradition to set off thousands of fireworks in elaborate displays. But if we stopped to consider the environmental impact of such extravagance, would we still choose this option or go for a safer, greener option
attributes.additional_details: Firework smoke has been shown to significantly increase breathing problems and have increased toxicity compared to traffic pollution. In this technologically advanced world we live in, surely we have the ability to come up with more inventive ways of using music, lights, and water displays to commemorate the new year.  In 2018, authorities in Dubai opted to light up the Burj Khalifa in a sensational display without fireworks, proving it can be done. We could save millions & our health-pls sign.

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums increased to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.

attributes.action: Offset any rise in the price of fuel
attributes.background: As Christmas is approaching, I would like to propose that if the price of a litre of fuel is to rise by 3p then the government should reduce the amount of tax on fuel by the very same amount. As a result, motorists will not be impacted by any fuel cost rises.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Rebate and partially rebate stamp duty on properties purchased since 22/11/16
attributes.background: The new stamp duty rules for houses under 300k and only partial for above is great news for new buyers. I was a new buyer 5 months ago and struggled to get stamp duty together.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that following the chancellor’s revelation on the 22/11/17, all properties purchased within the last 12 months, particularly ones purchased using help to buy, should have partial or full refunds on the stamp duty in line with the chancellor’s new ruled surrounding stamp duty

attributes.action: Make rent to own companies illegal
attributes.background: Some companies’ lending practices are targeting the "poorest, most desperate families" and operating in the "most deprived areas" of the UK. The customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. This is making people already in debt further in debt.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that they are targeting the UK's most vulnerable (poorest and most desperate families), and operating in the most deprived areas. Customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. Some base prices have also been noted to be higher than those of upscale mainstream retailers such as Harrods. This is totally unacceptable, with the interest rates in need of review.

attributes.action: Change and restrict the dates for sale of fireworks around bonfire night.
attributes.background: We all know that bans do not work, we all know that bonfire night isn't going anywhere, but did you know that the sale of fireworks around bonfire night starts from the 15th of October to the 8th of November that's 25 days of sale. Potentially 4 weeks of fireworks going off in any one area.
attributes.additional_details:
There are members of the public who are not sensible and continuously break the law, setting off fireworks in proximity to peoples homes and even terrorising and subjecting abuse to other members of the public for up to the whole 4 weeks of sale. Unfortunately animals are also very easily abused with fireworks too, many incidents include tieing them to animals and setting them off.
I call to get the sale dates changed and restricted to less than 14 days around the time of bonfire night.

attributes.action: Ban any future police usage of brainwave scanners (electroencephalograms).
attributes.background: EEG's read brainwaves and can compute, so far, very simple thoughts - with around 60 - 90% accuracy. Introduction of these, upon further development, voids the point of the majority of the police force and is a gross breach of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: In a world becoming more and more technological, there is only one true privacy left - the brain. Introduction of EEG's to the police force would bring Britain on a par with George Orwell's 1984, and would take away yet more power from the public - the people the Government are supposed to serve. EEG's should still be available to services such as the NHS, as with some development, people with locked in syndrome could communicate again. Apart from that, they should be illegal or banned.

attributes.action: Scrap or Re-evaluate Hazard Perception
attributes.background:
The 'hazard perception' part of UK theory tests is one of the most hated parts of becoming a learner driver. 
The hazard perception part is taken on a computer, where you click the screen when you see a developing hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
The problem with this part of the theory test is that you have to spot 'developing hazards', and if you spot a hazard 'too early' you do not get the marks. Put this into real life, spotting a hazard too early? The entire marking scheme is pathetic. 
I do not disagree with the idea however, as spotting hazards is essential for safe driving. The hazard perception should be incorporated in the practical test and marked by an examiner, someone able to think, and not a computer.

attributes.action: Change laws for British citizenship so they refer to ‘parent’ not ‘father’.
attributes.background:
The right to British citizenship depends on a number factors but sometimes, just the father.

An example is seen here: https://www.gov.uk/register-british-citizen/born-before-2006-british-father.

There is no need for gender at all.

attributes.action: To made possible to claim disability discrimination when applying for a school.
attributes.background: Currently, the law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against Local Authority when they fail to secure a place at chosen school. The decision is made by Local Authority and SEND Tribunal can only act aginst schools.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Lower the math entry requirement to a Grade D, to access teacher training.
attributes.background: Many Passionate individuals like myself are not able to access teacher training courses due to receiving a grade D at GCSE level. This is creating a problem of shortages of teachers, since many are simply not able to active peruse their dreams in helping the younger generation achieve their best.
attributes.additional_details: Why would you need math to teach English, Sociology or other non math based/ limited math courses. It seems that achieving a Grade D in math at GCSE portrays the idea that we cannot do math. This is absolutely absurd, just because people did not achieve a grade C or above does not mean we cannot do the basic math. I simply believe, to become a teacher within the UK, math should only be a requirement depending on the type of Course the individual would like to teach.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.
